question_text: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
explanation: The 'color' property in CSS is used to set the text color of an element.

question_text: What is the purpose of the React useEffect hook?
options: To perform side effects in functional components
explanation: useEffect is used to perform side effects in functional components, such as data fetching, subscriptions, or DOM manipulation.

question_text: Which HTML5 element is best suited for navigation links?
explanation: The <nav> element is semantically correct for containing navigation links.

question_text: What is the main advantage of using CSS Grid over Flexbox?
explanation: CSS Grid provides two-dimensional layout control (rows and columns), while Flexbox is primarily one-dimensional.

question_text: Which JavaScript method is used to add an element to the end of an array?
explanation: The push() method adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new length.

question_text: What does responsive web design ensure?
explanation: Responsive web design ensures that web pages display properly on various devices and screen sizes.

question_text: In Vue.js, what is the purpose of the v-model directive?
explanation: v-model provides two-way data binding between form inputs and component data.

question_text: What is the purpose of CSS custom properties (variables)?
options: To enable dynamic styling and code reuse
explanation: CSS custom properties (variables) enable dynamic styling and code reuse by storing values that can be reused throughout the stylesheet.

question_text: Which JavaScript concept allows handling asynchronous operations?
explanation: Callbacks, Promises, and Async/Await are all ways to handle asynchronous operations in JavaScript.

question_text: What is the purpose of semantic HTML?
explanation: Semantic HTML improves accessibility for screen readers and helps search engines understand page structure.

question_text: What is the virtual DOM in React?
options: A copy of the real DOM
A JavaScript representation of the DOM
explanation: The virtual DOM is a JavaScript representation of the real DOM that React uses to optimize updates.

question_text: Which CSS unit is relative to the font size of the parent element?
explanation: The 'em' unit is relative to the font size of the parent element, while 'rem' is relative to the root font size.

question_text: What does the HTML5 doctype declaration specify?
options: The character encoding of the document
The document type and HTML version
The CSS version to be used
explanation: The doctype declaration <!DOCTYPE html> specifies that the document is an HTML5 document, which helps browsers render the page correctly.

question_text: Which HTML5 element is used to define navigation links?
explanation: The <nav> element in HTML5 is specifically designed to contain navigation links for the website or application.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <header> element in HTML5?
options: To display the website header image
To define a container for introductory content
To define the main heading of the page
explanation: The <header> element represents a container for introductory content or navigational links, typically containing headings, logos, or search forms.

question_text: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
explanation: The 'color' property in CSS is used to set the text color of an element.

question_text: What does the CSS box model consist of?
explanation: The CSS box model consists of content, padding, border, and margin, which determine the space an element occupies.

question_text: Which HTML5 element is best suited for marking up a single piece of content that can stand alone?
explanation: The <article> element represents a self-contained composition that could be distributed and reused independently.

question_text: Which CSS property is used to create space around elements?
explanation: The 'margin' property creates space around elements, outside of any defined borders.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <main> element in HTML5?
options: To define the main content area
explanation: The <main> element specifies the main content of a document, and there should only be one <main> element per page.

question_text: Which CSS property controls the transparency of an element?
explanation: The 'opacity' property sets the transparency level of an element, with values from 0 (fully transparent) to 1 (fully opaque).

question_text: What is the difference between <div> and <span>?
explanation: <div> is a block-level element that takes up the full width available, while <span> is an inline element that only takes up as much width as necessary.
